content:
The ArrayList object is part of the java.util package. The difference between a built-in array and the ArrayList object is as follows:
- a built-in array canon the modified: if you intend on adding/removing elements, you have to create a new array
- new elements can be added/removed from an ArrayList whenever you want.
name: ArrayList
syntax: ArrayList< Data Type > name = new ArrayList< Data Type >();

methods.name: ArrayList
methods.content: The ArrayList constructor allows you to create a new ArrayList object.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"C","type":"Collection","description":"Not required. You can send over a Collection and the ArrayList will populate with the elements from Collection C."},{"name":"capacity","type":"int","description":"Not required. int capacity is the specified size of the ArrayList."}]

methods.name: add
methods.content:
The add method is used to add a specific element to the list. There are two commonly used variations of the add() method:
- add(Object element). This method appends the element to the end of the list.
- add(int index, Object element). This method inserts the element at a specific index within the list.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"element","type":"Object","required":true,"description":"The object that you want to add to the ArrayList"},{"name":"index","type":"int","description":"Not required. The index specifies the position at which you want to insert the specified element."}]
methods.syntax:
public void add(Object element);

public void add(int index, Object element);

methods.name: get
methods.content: This method allows you to get the object at the specified index from the ArrayList.

methods.name: remove
methods.content: This method allows you to remove a specific element from an ArrayList object.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"index","type":"int","description":"index of the element to be removed"}]

methods.name: size
methods.content: Returns the size of the ArrayList object
